eu.amidst.core.distribution

Class ConditionalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.amidst.core.distribution.Distribution
      • eu.amidst.core.distribution.ConditionalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseDistribution_MultinomialParents, ConditionalLinearGaussian, IndicatorDistribution, Multinomial_LogisticParents, Multinomial_MultinomialParents, Normal_MultinomialNormalParents, Normal_MultinomialParents, UnivariateDistribution

    public abstract class ConditionalDistribution
extends Distribution
    This class extends the abstract class Distribution. It defines the conditional distribution of a node (i.e., Variable) given the set of its parents.

    For an example of use follow this link

    http://amidst.github.io/toolbox/CodeExamples.html#bnmodifyexample

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getConditioningVariables

        public java.util.List<Variable> getConditioningVariables()
        Returns the set of conditioning variables, i.e., the list of parents in this ConditionalDistribution.
        Returns:
        a List object containing the set of parents.

      • setConditioningVariables

        public void setConditioningVariables(java.util.List<Variable> parents)
        Sets the set of conditioning variables, i.e., the list of parents in this ConditionalDistribution. WARNING: This method should only be used in exceptional cases. It may affect the coherence of the graphical model.
        Parameters:
        parents - a List of Variable representing the parents of this variable.

      • getConditionalProbability

        public double getConditionalProbability(Assignment assignment)
        Returns the conditional probability of an Assignment given this ConditionalDistribution.
        Parameters:
        assignment - an Assignment object.
        Returns:
        a double representing the probability of an assignment.

      • toEFConditionalDistribution

        public <E extends EF_ConditionalDistribution> E toEFConditionalDistribution()
        Converts this ConditionalDistribution to an Exponential Family (EF) conditional distribution
        Type Parameters:
        E - any class extending EF_ConditionalDistribution
        Returns:
        an EF_ConditionalDistribution object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this distribution is not convertible to EF form.
